title: Standard form of a circle
text: The standard form of a circle is $${\left(x-h\right)}^2+{\left(y-k\right)}^2=r^2$$.
speech: The standard form of a circle is  parentheses x minus h,  squared plus, parentheses y minus k,  squared is equal to r squared .
pacedSpeech: The standard form of a circle is    x minus h,  squared plus,  y minus k,  squared is equal to r squared

title: Center
text: The center of an equation of a circle in standard form is (h,k). We can rewrite the equation as $${\left(x-2\right)}^2+{\left(y-3\right)}^2=3^2$$. From here we get the center is $$(2,3)$$.
speech: The center of an equation of a circle in standard form is (h,k). We can rewrite the equation as  parentheses x minus 2,  squared plus, parentheses y minus 3,  squared is equal to 3 squared . From here we get the center is , parentheses 2 comma 3,  .

. From here we get the center is  ,  2 comma 3,

title: Radius
text: The radius of an equation of a circle in standard form is simply the $$r$$ value. Note that in the standard form of the circle, $$r$$ is squared. We can rewrite the equation as $${\left(x-2\right)}^2+{\left(y-3\right)}^2=3^2$$. From here we get the radius is $$3$$.
speech: The radius of an equation of a circle in standard form is simply the  r  value. Note that in the standard form of the circle,  r  is squared. We can rewrite the equation as , parentheses x minus 2,  squared plus, parentheses y minus 3,  squared is equal to, 3 squared . From here we get the radius is  3 .
